text.headline: Normandie Golf Course
text.text:
The Normandie Golf Course renovation in St. Louis is a project that is being spearheaded by Jack Nicklaus with Tom O'Toole from the USGA. The Metropolitan Golf Foundation, the philanthropic arm of the Metropolitan Amateur Golf Association, owns Normandie Golf Club. The course was acquired from the University of Missouri-St. Louis in 2022 for $1.5 million. The goal of the project is to revitalize the historic golf course with new graassing and bunker liner technology.

The renovation will include a number of changes to the course, including new flat tee boxes with newly sloping greens. Updating the irrigation system is a major undertaking the project. The renovation is expected to cost $15 million and start in September 2023 with an opening date in autumn 2024.

The Normandie Golf Course renovation is a significant project that will have a major impact on the St. Louis golf community. The new course will be a valuable asset to the city and Metropolitan Golf Foundation.
